_header: In every place where that I wend / My purse is my own friend
_description: ‘Gremercy Mine own Purse’ — five quatrains (aaab) with this refrain and burden: ‘I may syng & sey iwys / Gremercy my owne [purse]’

CamStJohn259.First Lines:
In euery plas qwere þat I wendeMy purse is my owne
                    frende…
CamStJohn259.Last Lines:
…Þan I may I well my song vowyngre mercy my own
                    purse
CamStJohn259.Editions:
James,  Montague Rhodes,  and  G. C. Macaulay, eds.  
             “Fifteenth Century Carols and Other Pieces.” 
             Modern Language Review
         8 (1913): 68-87: 72.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 260-1; 1977, 230-1.
